document.docAuthor: Mauffray, William F. & Tennessen, Kenneth J.
document.masterDocTitle: A Catalogue and Historical Study of the Odonata of Ecuador

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Catalogue and Historical Study of the Odonata of Ecuador

subSubSection.paragraph: A genus of at least 25 species, with six and possibly more recorded in Ecuador (specimens of several species are yet to be resolved). Adults are dark with a small amount of blue or purple on the thorax ( Fig. 49 ); they perch with their wings held flat. Species identification is based mainly on prothorax and male appendage morphology ( De Marmels 2001a ). Nymphs live in small, forested streams, often below waterfalls, although nymphs of few species have been described.

Teinopodagrion angulatum De Marmels, 2001
. Publ. Recs. ECU: (H08), (P11), (H14); PA : De Marmels (2001a— Holotype ♂ : [ Santa Clara ], Yanamanaca, Río Napo watershed; 6 x 1935 , leg. WCM [UMMZ]),
Garrison et al . (2003)
.

caption.paragraph: FIGURE 49. Teinopodagrion croizati ♂, ECUADOR, Azuay Prov., stream 21 km E of Hwy. 25, 11 iv 2008; photo K. J. Ten- nessen.

Teinopodagrion setigerum (Selys, 1886)
. Publ. Recs. ECU: Kirby (1890) , Schmidt (1942) , Kimmins (1970) , Paulson (1983) , Tsuda (1986 , 1991 ), Steinmann (1997a) , Garrison (1991), (—all as
Megapodagrion setigerum )
, Bridges (1993 —as
Allopodagrion setigerum
),
Daigle et al. (1996
—as
Allopodagrion
sp.), Tennessen (1998 as
Allopodagrion
sp.), (H08), (P11), (H14); IM : *Selys (1886— Holotype : [ Cotacachi ], “Intag” -[Apuela, NE on Apuela-Cuicocha Road, along Río Intag and tributaries between 1800–2800m ( 0.3588 , -78.4509 ), at jct of Río Intag and tributary.], date?, leg.?, [ BMNH] ), Davies & Tobin (1984) —as
M. setigerum
; Bridges (1993 —as

); NA :

M. temporale
), De Marmels (2001a) ; PA: De Marmels (2001a) . Also PER: [FSCA].

Teinopodagrion
unresolved.
There are several specimens that have not been determined and may represent undescribed species: CT, Sigchos: 1 ♀ , San Francisco de las Pampas Otonga Reserve, (-0.42, -79.0, 1700m ), 14 ii 97 , leg. Elicio Tapia, det.? [FSCA]; same data but 1 ♂ , Epola Lluviosa, (-0.26, -79.0, 2000m ), 9 x 1997 [FSCA]; ES, San Lorenzo: 1 ♂ , seepage tributary 5.6 km NW of Lita near Finca Consuegros, 4 ii 1997 , leg. JJD, det. JJD [ JJD-FSCA ]; MS, Gualaquiza: 1 ♀ , Bomboiza , 17 km S [should be “N”] of Gualaquiza ,
20 ix 1990
, leg. OSF , det.? [ USNM ];
PC, Quito :
1 ♂ , Septimo Paraiso Lodge , 3 km northeast of Mindo , small forest stream in the sun ( - 0.0308 , -78.7633 ),
11 x 2009
, leg. WAH & Fred Morrison , det. RWG as “an undescribed species cf.
T. nebulosum ”
(RWG pers. comm. 2017).
